title: Performance rules (general)
description: General performance rules for maintenance, preventive maintenance, rebuilding, and alteration
content: Each person performing maintenance, preventive maintenance, or alteration on an aircraft, engine, propeller, or appliance shall use the methods, techniques, and practices prescribed in the current manufacturer's maintenance manual or Instructions for Continued Airworthiness prepared by its manufacturer, or other methods, techniques, and practices acceptable to the Administrator, except as noted in ยง43.16.

title: Acceptable Methods, Techniques, and Practices - Aircraft Inspection and Repair
description: Advisory circular providing acceptable methods, techniques, and practices for aircraft inspection and repair
content: This advisory circular (AC) contains methods, techniques, and practices acceptable to the Administrator for the inspection and repair of nonpressurized areas of civil aircraft, only when there are no manufacturer repair or maintenance instructions. This data generally pertains to minor repairs. The repairs identified in this AC may only be used as a basis for FAA approval for major repairs.

title: Additional performance rules for inspections
description: Additional performance rules for inspections, including annual, 100-hour, and progressive inspections
content: Each person performing an inspection required by part 91, 125, or 135 of this chapter shall perform the inspection so as to determine whether the aircraft, or portion(s) thereof under inspection, meets all applicable airworthiness requirements.

title: Altimeter system and altitude reporting equipment tests and inspections
description: Requirements for altimeter system and altitude reporting equipment tests and inspections
content: No person may operate an airplane, or helicopter, in controlled airspace under IFR unless the altimeter system and altitude reporting equipment have been tested and inspected within the preceding 24 calendar months.

title: ATC transponder tests and inspections
description: Requirements for ATC transponder tests and inspections
content: No person may use an ATC transponder that is specified in 91.215(a), 121.345(c), or ยง135.143(c) of this chapter unless, within the preceding 24 calendar months, the ATC transponder has been tested and inspected and found to comply with appendix F of part 43 of this chapter.

title: Pressurized cabins
description: Requirements for pressurized cabins in transport category aircraft
content: Pressurized cabins and compartments to be occupied must be equipped to provide a cabin pressure altitude of not more than 8,000 feet at the maximum operating altitude of the airplane under normal operating conditions.

title: Water in Aviation Fuels
description: Advisory circular on water in aviation fuels
content: This advisory circular provides information on the hazards of water in aviation fuel, types of water contamination, and methods for detection and removal of water from fuel systems.

title: Visual Inspection for Aircraft
description: Advisory circular on visual inspection for aircraft
content: This advisory circular provides guidance on visual inspection methods for aircraft structures, systems, and components.
